Interface Candidate

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    PluralityCandidate, STVCandidate

    public interface Candidate

    Candidate

    Candidate - is an interface for the voting system which declares function names and parameters for the two different types of candidate classes that will be used in the voting. The two types of candidate classes are:
    • PluralityCandidate - Specialised Candidate to store information for Plurality based Voting
    • STVCandidate - Specialised Candidate to store information for STV based Voting
    Candidates are expected to at least hold information like a unique ID, name, select status etc.
    Since:
    2018-03-13
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Team 8 (Saksham Goel - goelx029 | Kunal Munjal - munja004 | Abhishek Sairavi - saira005)

      • getNumberOfVotesEarnedByCandidate

        int getNumberOfVotesEarnedByCandidate​()
        Returns the number of votes the candidate has accumulated. This is calculated by aggregating the number of ballots assigned to the particular candidate.
        Returns:
        int - Number of votes earned by the candidate.

      • getSelectStatus

        boolean getSelectStatus​()
        Returns the select status of a candidate. Select status tells whether a candidate has been declared a winner or not.
        Returns:
        boolean - Status of a candidate.

      • setSelectStatus

        void setSelectStatus​(boolean status)
        Modifies the select status of the candidate.
        Parameters:
        status - New status of the candidate.
